div.p: V62/302, unit 868, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Thankfully returning this letter
On 24 October 1861 James Finn, British Consul at Jerusalem wrote to John O'Shanassy, Chief Secretary at Melbourne: 'I beg leave to express my sincere thanks for the second supply of tree and grass-seeds, recently received through H. M. Consulate at Cairo.' (V62/302, unit 868, VPRS 1189/P, PROV). The letter was forwarded to M for comment on 14 January 1862. I beg to state, that it is my intention to send an other consignment of seeds of heat resisting plants now gathered to Jerusalem, where the cultivation of those received before has proved very successful.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
